instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not power with charger but work fine on battery
threads.message: hello guys, have got n <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that would not power on charger but works 100% on battery . I do not seem to fully understand the 2018 model of operation , I measure 12.30V on PPBUS with charger only connected and 5V in PPDCIN, I have checked for a short to ground but no short, the only thing I could notice is 0V at <SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, I don't know if that's suppose to be high like <SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_L</SIGNAL> signal . I believe when any of the CD3215s are faulty , the machine wouldn't power with the battery either, please correct me on this , as I could be wrong

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not power with charger but work fine on battery
threads.message:
All USB-C ports have the same behaviour?
Check in both ways conneciton.

Compare diode mode readings between <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips on their LDO power rails.
Also check voltage, especially if 1V1 LDO appears on each <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip, when connect charger to its port.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not power with charger but work fine on battery
threads.message: Will do that now , and about this signal being low <SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_IN</SIGNAL>,  I suppose it has nothing to do , and also if the issue was a <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>, would it work with the charger ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not power with charger but work fine on battery
threads.message:
06.26 on diode mode to ground on 2 of the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> and 06.9 on other 2 , on opposite sides , meaning when I flip the board one side I get 06.26 on both and when I flip to the other side I get 06.9.  

I get 1V1 LDO voltage at all 4 CD3215s

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not power with charger but work fine on battery
threads.message:
Your problem should be only USB-C related, as the board works on battery alone.
That reset signal looks good, as it has no "L" on its name.

Did you try original 87W charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not power with charger but work fine on battery
threads.message: Yes, am using an 87W charger , is there something I can check next ?
